title: The Dow Slipped 23 Points Because Americans Shopped Till They Dropped
text:
Mixed Bag. The main U.S. stock indexes slipped on Wednesday amid mixed headlines. Earnings continued to be well received, with Bank of America (ticker: BAC) reporting better-than-expected profit. On the other hand, U.S. retail sales fell unexpectedly in September. General Motors stock (GM) jumped after the company reached a tentative deal with its striking workers. Major drug distributors also rose after reports of talks to settle sweeping litigation about their role in the opioid crisis. In today’s After the Bell, we...

check on Wednesday’s earnings reports from big banks and others; look into the first retail...
description: The main U.S. stock indexes slipped on Wednesday amid mixed headlines. Earnings continued to be well received, but U.S. retail sales fell unexpectedly in September.
